result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles J Dallapiazza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Involve Injury, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  (payable during confinement/supervision on 14CF331)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Transcript: Sentencing Hearing      5/8/2015      Terri Knowles
Defendant Charles J Dallapiazza in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
PSI faxed to Attorney Tishberg at 4:05 pm.
Copy emailed to DA.  Left message with Attorney, hearing is 5/8/15, how would Attorney like to receive his copy.
Forwarded to Branch 1 for review.
Copies of Letters from M.D. and J.D. forwarded to DA/Atty. Tishberg.
Letter from J.D. to the court.   Scanned and forwarded to Branch 1 for review.
Letter from M.D. to the court. Scanned and forwarded to Branch 1 for review.
Sentencing hearing on May 8, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Charles J Dallapiazza in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court examines defendant and finds defendant guilty. State recommends a presentence report. At the time of sentencing State will recommend 9 months concurrent to prison term on 14CF331. Defense free to argue penalty. Court orders a presentence report be filed and adjourns sentencing. Court remands defendant to custody.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 19, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Charles J Dallapiazza in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Tishberg requests an additional 45/60 days to review file. Court adjourns sentencing on probation revocation 12CF16/12CF20 and plea/sentencing on 14CF330/331.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Further proceedings on February 2, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Charles J Dallapiazza in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend Ct. 3 of the complaint to Ct. 2, this is a typographical error.  Court so orders. Detective M. McNerney sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Sisley. Court finds probable cause and binds case over for trial. State files information. Defense waives reading, enters not guilty plea. Condition of bail to continue.
Preliminary hearing on December 18, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Charles J Dallapiazza in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Tishberg reserves all jurisdictional challenges. Atty. Tishberg states he has received copies of complaints on both cases. Atty. Tishberg requests preliminary hearing on both cases.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
w/condition: $25,000 cash on this case and $25,0000 cash on 14CF331 totaling $50,000. No contact with victim C.C. or J, no contact with anyone under 18 years.

Defendant has 2 cases 14CF330/14CF331. Defendant Charles J Dallapiazza in court, in custody.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advises defendant of complaint/penalties thereof. Defendant stated he will have Atty. Mark Tishberg. Court finds good cause for not scheduling a preliminary hearing. Court is informed there is a hold on defendant. State recommendation $15,000 cash bail w/condition no contact with victim or J or anyone under 17 years. Court orders $25,000 cash bail on each case totaling $50,000 w/conditions.
Initial appearance on December 18, 2014 at 08:45 am.
